label: Description
value: Geometric floral designs in pink and blue that appear in the earliest of the 16th century pattern books

value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in counted stitches on plain weave

label: Description
value: Square sampler in two sections. The upper register has bands of small scale geometric and floral patterns and spot motifs. The lower register has a deer, a bird on a flowering branch, and a girl in a pinafore with a wreath.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation Technique: embroidered in cross, back, straight, running, scotch and tent stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Notes
value: Square sampler in two sections. The upper register has bands of small scale geometric and floral patterns and spot motifs. The lower register has a deer, a bird on a flowering branch, and a girl in a pinafore with a wreath.

label: Description
value: Fragment with a central design of carnations in a vase with reindeer on either side.

label: Description
value: Embroidered in many colors on a black embroidered ground; a center panel with upper and lower case alphabets, numerals and the signature, and a wide floral border. The black background stops with an outer border of green cross stitch one row thick.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in satin, eyelet, cross, long armed cross, rococco variation, chain and couching stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Notes
value: Embroidered in many colors on a black embroidered ground; a center panel with upper and lower case alphabets, numerals and the signature, and a wide floral border. The black background stops with an outer border of green cross stitch one row thick.

label: Description
value: Rectangular sampler with many small bands and squares of geometric patterns, in blues, greens, yellows, pinks and reds on white. The right side is dominated by two large areas of deflected element work in red and green.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and linen embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in deflected and withdrawn element work, and needle lace stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Provenance
value: Brought from Mrs. Tosica Rotch in Guatemala City in the 1930s.

label: Notes
value: Rectangular sampler with many small bands and squares of geometric patterns, in blues, greens, yellows, pinks and reds on white. The right side is dominated by two large areas of deflected element work in red and green.

label: Description
value: Drawnwork sampler with beadwork edge showing pairs of animals with flowers, and bands of multicolored silk embroidery on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen, glass beads Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Square sampler with two large circular holes and outer borders cut away in lower right corner. Center field with spot motifs surrounded by inscription bands and geometric borders. Inscription reads: "Lo hyzo Marya Ramona Ascension Dorado en Zamora en el mes de otubre" or "Made by Marya Ramona Ascension Dorado in Zamora in the month of October."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Top left corner has embroidery and bottom left corner alternates areas of embroidery with areas of openwork. Vertical areas of openwork on the right with abstracted or decorative embroidery in between.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value:
Small sampler with central square filled with embroidered objects i.e. rider on horseback, man walking a dog, floral forms with birds, man picking fruit, two men fishing, a fountain, small building, and a heart surrounded by a band of writing: "LO. HIZO. CATALINA. DE. ARANAGA. SIENDO DICIPOLA. DE. LA. SA MAESTRA DA MARIA. DE ACHOTEQUI. EN LA EDA DE 10  ANOS ANO DE 1832."

Translation: "Made by Catalina de Aranaga under the instruction of her teacher Senora Maria de Achotequi. Aged 10 years. In the Year of 1832."

Surrounded by wide borders - two of which are the same but the colors are reversed.  All embroidered in red and blue on white background.  Except for very narrow borders and some writing, all executed in cross stitch.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, cotton Technique: embroidered using cross, foursided, and running stitches

label: Description
value: Large square sampler by Maria Brigida Sanchez Mansilla is embroidered with a central square containing floral and bird motifs. Center is surrounded by a series of borders containing a variety of geometric and floral patterning.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen Technique: embroidered in satin and chain stitch on plain weave

label: Description
value: Unfinished sampler with many small areas of geometric, figural and bird motifs in multicolored silk on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Sample with a blank central square; border with many geometric bands of multicolored silk on linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium silk on linen Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Rectangular shape.  Top edge filled by eight squares each with a different pattern which may be woven on a four-harness loom.  Yellow, rust, green and blue on a natural ground.  Also eight different patterns along the right hand margin of each square that are unfinished.  At bottom: "Marie Claerejo ANNO 1753."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: cross stitch

label: Description
value:
Two varied borders (including vine and chevron patterns) surrounding center of animal figures, foral motifs, and the words: "DE MANO DE DOLORES CORTES LO ACABO EL DIA 17 DE AGOSTO."

Translation: "From the hand of Dolores Cortes, finished on the 17th of August."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered

value: Sampler with many small rectangles of drawnwork patterning interspaced with lines of silk embroidery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value:
Rectangular embroidery sampler with tassels at the four corners and three bands of different instances of the alphabet. Below the alphabet is one band showing a human (hunter), dog, flowers, house, and bird and another band of flowers. At the bottom the piece reads: "Lo Hizo Teresa Alvares y Gimenez Grazalema 22 de Febrero de 1854"
Translation: "Made by Teresa Alvares y Gimenez Grazalema February 22, 1854"

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (with tassels): 62.9 x 29.8 cm (24 3/4 x 11 3/4 in.) H x W (without tassels): 55.9 x 24.4 cm (22 x 9 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Sampler divided vertically into quadrants; three show embroidered silk bands and rectangles of geometric patterning; one shows bands of drawnwork.
